page.title: 10Pant Valley Fish Farm
page.content: The farm is at{Shalford,}on the river{Pant,}near{Codham Mill. Peter {Richardson}set up the farm and the present owner,{Adrian Deane}took over in September 1984. There are eight fish tanks, each holding 10,000 litres of water. The farm uses 500,000 litres a day, cycled from the{Pant. The farm stocks mainly{rainbow {trout.}Other species of fish include eel, crayfish, goldfish, koi carp, gold and silver tench and rudd. Fry is obtained from{Kings Lynn. The trout takes about eight months to reach a table weight of about 14oz. Restaurants within a 25 mile radius are supplied. Local people come and buy during limited opening times. At the farm trout, eels, and prawns are smoked. The most expensive fish is an ornamental koi carp at Â£1,000.
